Recipe.title: Dutch Oven Fried Rice
Recipe.yieldsNote: or 15-20 if just used as a side dish
Recipe.Source: Based on a Recipe from Joy of Cooking
Recipe.Description: Ransom used Joy of Cooking recipe book while on his mission. (It is still his favorite.) When he got home from his mission, he adapted the recipe to be an entree cooked in a Dutch Oven.

section.instruction: Place Dutch Oven on medium amount of charcoals.
Add Oil and Uncooked Rice and saut&accentedLowerE;, stirring/scraping frequently until Rice begins to brown.
Add Water and Salt and stir well.
Cook with the lid on, stirring occasionally until Rice is cooked. (≈20-45 minutes)
Dig as large of a hole as possible in the center, all the way to the bottom. Then add Eggs and stir them (not Rice) until it is fully-cooked pieces.
Add Ham, Chineese Cabbage, Carrots, and Onion then stir and let steam for 5-10 minutes.
Add Soy Sauce and stir very well.

Modifications.modification: Instead of Chinese Cabbage, use Celery Greens
Replace some or all of the Onions with Scallions cut into ½&inch; lengths.
If it just going to be a side dish, the amount of Ham can be reduced or left out completely.
Instead of Ham, use pre-cooked Chicken or Beef pieces.
